p: In children with hematological malignancies and/or HSCT, hRV was found in 23–62% of URTI [ 29– 32] and 65% of LRTI [ 14]. In this last work, the mean age of children was 6.9 years, and half of the patients affected by a respiratory virus had a diagnosis of leukemia or lymphoma (LL). hRV was the most detected virus in all the patients recruited in the study (hematological, with solid tumor or post-HSCT). In patients affected by leukemia or lymphoma and by a viral infection, hRV was detected in 65% of URTI and 59% of LRTI, while in children the virus represented 77% of URTI and 50% of LRTI in the post-HSCT period [ 14].
